des:
*Note: Camera image encryption must be disabled to work with Alexa

Follow the steps below to setup your camera and link your EZVIZ Link account:
1. From the EZVIZ Link Mobile App, select a suitable name for your smart device (i.e., baby room, front door, etc.)
2. From the EZVIZ Link Mobile App, disable Image Encryption for the camera you wish to setup
3. From your Alexa App, search for EZLink, enable the skill and link it to your EZVIZ Link account by signing in with your EZVIZ Link account
4. Discover your cameras by asking Alexa “Discover devices” or by pressing the Discover Devices button in the Alexa app

Once your account is linked, viewing your cameras is supported on Amazon Echo Show, Echo Spot, Fire TV, 2nd Gen Fire Stick or Fire Tablets (7th gen and above). To see your camera, just say “Alexa, show the (device name)” 

Some important notes: 
• Before connecting to Amazon Echo Show, Echo Spot or Fire TV, log in to your EZVIZ Link App and go to the camera settings. Look for “Image Encryption” and tap to turn it off. Tap “OK” when the prompt appears. Enter the Verification Code to apply the change.
• How to change the name of your EZVIZ Link camera: Once the camera has been added to your EZVIZ Link account, you can change its name in the EZVIZ Link smart device settings page. Select a suitable name for your device, such as “baby room” or “front door.” 
• You can view live feeds from EZVIZ smart device on your Amazon Echo Show or Fire TV by saying the command “Alexa, turn on the (device name).” 

For additional information and resources, please visit EZVIZ Link online at www.ezvizlife.com, or contact our support team at 1-855-693-9849 or service@ezvizlife.com.
